newsitem.title: JAPAN: Toshiba to make colour TVs in China from 1997.
newsitem.headline: Toshiba to make colour TVs in China from 1997.

text.p: Toshiba Corp said on Tuesday it plans to set up a joint venture with Nichimen Corp and a Chinese partner which will invest 10 billion yen to make colour television sets in Dalian in northern China from October 1997.
The venture, to be capitalised at $50 million, will be 65 percent owned by the Toshiba group, five percent by Nichimen and the rest by Dalian Daxian Group Corp, a Toshiba spokesman said.
The venture will start construction of a plant in October 1996.
The venture will produce 21-inch to 29-inch colour television sets, and will be capable of producing one million television sets a year, he said.
Products will be sold in China and also exported, mainly to other Asian countries.
